Foundation for Sites Documentation Version 6.0.0-alpha

Menu Bar

Our flexible menu bar component makes it easy to build many common navigation patterns, all with the same markup.

  • On this page:
  • Contribute:
  • Edit this Page
  • Report a Bug
  • View Source

The menu bar is a flexible, all-purpose component for navigation. It replaces Foundation 5's inline list, side nav, sub nav, and icon bar, unifying them into one component.

Basic Menu Bar

All versions of the menu bar are a <ul> filled with <li> elements containing links. By default, a menu bar is horizontally oriented.

<ul class="menu-bar">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Item Alignment

By default, each item in the menu bar aligns to the left. They can also be aligned to the right with the .align-right class.

<ul class="menu-bar align-right">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Items can also be set to expand out and take up an even amount of space, with the .expanded class. Thanks to the magic of CSS, the items will automatically size themselves equally depending on how many are inside the menu.

<ul class="menu-bar expanded">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Vertical Menu Bar

Add the .vertical class to a menu bar to switch its orientation.

<ul class="menu-bar vertical">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Simple Style

Add the .simple class to a menu bar to remove the padding and color change. This style imitates the inline list from Foundation 5.

<ul class="menu-bar simple">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Colored Style

Add the .primary class to a menu bar to give it color. The color used is the $primary-color variable in the settings file.

<ul class="menu-bar primary">
  <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Nested Style

Add a new menu bar inside the <li> of a menu bar and add the class .nested to create a nested menu bar. The nested menu bar has extra padding on the inside.

<ul class="vertical menu-bar">
  <li>
    <a href="#">One</a>
    <ul class="nested vertical menu-bar">
      <li><a href="#">One</a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li><a href="#">Two</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Three</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Four</a></li>
</ul>
  • One
    • One
    • Two
    • Three
    • Four
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Icons

Menu bar items can have icons. Wrap the text of the item in a <span>, and then add an <img> element before the <span>. If you're using the Foundation icon font, the <img> will be an <i> instead.

<ul class="menu-bar">
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>One</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Two</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Three</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Four</span></a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Add the class .icon-top to the menu bar to orient icons above the text.

<ul class="menu-bar icon-top">
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>One</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Two</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Three</span></a></li>
  <li><a href="#"><i class="fi-list"></i> <span>Four</span></a></li>
</ul>
  • One
  • Two
  • Three
  • Four

Sass Reference

Variables

The default styles of this component can be customized using these Sass variables in your project's settings file.

NameTypeDefault ValueDescription
$menubar-margin Number 0

Default margin of a menu bar.
$menubar-background Color transparent

Default background color of a menu bar.
$menubar-item-color Color foreground($menubar-background, $primary-color)

Default text color for items in a menu bar.
$menubar-item-background-hover #eee

Default background color on hover for items in a menu bar.
$menubar-item-padding Number 0.7rem 1rem

Default padding for items in a menu bar.
$menubar-icon-spacing Number 0.25rem

Default spacing between an icon and text in a menu bar item.
$menubar-expand-max Number 6

Maximum number of expand-n classes to include in the CSS.

Mixins

We use these mixins to build the final CSS output of this component. You can use the mixins yourself to build your own class structure out of our components.

menu-bar-base

@include menu-bar-base;

Creates the base styles for a menu bar.

menu-bar-expand

@include menu-bar-expand($count);

Expands the items of a menu bar, so each item is the same width.

ParameterTypeDefault ValueDescription
$count Keyword or Number auto

Number of items in the menu bar. You can hardcode a number, or use auto to generate CSS that will adapt to the number of items inside the menu.

menu-bar-direction

@include menu-bar-direction($dir);

Sets the direction of a menu bar.

ParameterTypeDefault ValueDescription
$dir Keyword horizontal

Direction of the menu bar. Can be horizontal or vertical.

menu-bar-simple

@include menu-bar-simple;

Creates a simple menu bar, which has no padding or hover state.

menu-bar-nested

@include menu-bar-nested($padding);

Adds styles for a nested menu bar. You can pass in a padding amount, which will be applied to the left (or right in RTL) of each item in the menu bar.

ParameterTypeDefault ValueDescription
$padding Keyword or Number auto

Amount of padding to apply. Use auto to apply twice the padding of a normal menu bar item.

menu-bar-style

@include menu-bar-style;

Changes the default colors of a menu bar.

menu-bar-icons

@include menu-bar-icons($position, $base);

Adds support for icons to menu bar items.

ParameterTypeDefault ValueDescription
$position Keyword side

Positioning for icons. Can be side (left, or right on RTL) or top.
$base Boolean true

Set to false to prevent the shared CSS between side- and top-aligned icons from being printed. Set this to false if you're calling the mixin multiple times on the same element.

Foundation for Sites

Foundation is a responsive front-end framework made by ZURB, a product design company in Campbell, CA. This framework is the result of building web products & services since 1998.
